name: Cameron High School Additions & Renovations
full_address: 423 North Chestnut Street, Cameron, MO 64429, United States of America
description:
This project consists of construction of a new 2-floor, roughly 21,000 SF classroom wing to the south of the existing building, demolition of the existing south classroom wing, and various renovations inside the existing building.

Missouri Annual Wage Order No. 32 applies. This project is sales tax exempt.

Schedule of Alternates:
- Alternate #1: Reroof existing counselor space
- Alternate #2: Remodel Corridor C200 as indicated on the drawings
- Alternate #3: Reroof existing locker room area

Scopes of work include but are not limited to: final clean, survey & layout, demo, concrete, polished concrete, concrete saw cutting, masonry, misc. metals, structural steel fabrication & erection, metal stairs, rough carpentry, casework, finished carpentry, joint sealants, membrane roofing, metal roofing, sheet metal, sprayed insulation, doors/frames/hardware, glass & glazing, overhead coiling doors, drywall & framing, painting, flooring, acoustical ceilings, metal panels, tile, epoxy flooring, toilet partitions & bathroom accessories, lockers, tack boards and marker boards, operable partitions, fire extinguishers & cabinets, signage, solid surfaces, elevators, fire suppression, plumbing, HVAC, Electrical, Fire Alarm, Earthwork & Site Demo, Erosion Control, Fences & Gates, and Site Utilities.

Please send bids to myself (miles.perry@centric.build) and bids@centric.build

name: DSW - The Village at Shoal Creek, Kansas City MO
full_address: 8373 North Booth Avenue, Kansas City, MO 64158, United States of America
description:
**SUB CONTRACTOR INVITATION TO BID**

I am writing to you on behalf of Censor Construction, the general contractor participating in the bidding process for the upcoming DSW located at The Village at Shoal Creek – 8373 North Booth Avenue Kansas City, MO.

We are currently in the process of seeking qualified subcontractors to participate in the bidding process for this exciting project for a regular client of ours.

Project Details:
Client: DSW
Location: 8373 North Booth Avenue Kansas City, MO
Plans: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/t4sb4s4rwxaict6jnebvd/APIKzvNVa5aW85SJxOIlWHc?rlkey=0jivt51pw55cjo9cyo8vyeklx&dl=0
Photos: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/3srjffpo5wb84lzzqzvb4/AL0DRvQ6656unSN1ee69XoI?rlkey=1vxq03a7ldy4hrz80hxktgd8e&dl=0
Labor Requirements: Non Union
Bid Due Date: Tuesday, 2/10
Bid Due Time: 5:00pm PST – No Late Bids Please!!
Anticipated Start Date:  3/9/26

Instructions for Bid Submission:
  • All bids should be submitted to me at brittany@censorconstruction.com by the specified due date and time.
  • If you are interested in submitting a bid for this project, please ensure that your proposal is submitted no later than the specified bid due date and time. 
  • Clearly mark your bid package with the project name: Bid Submission – DSW – KC

If you have any questions or require additional information, please feel free to contact me via email with your questions. Thank you for considering this opportunity and we look forward to receiving your bid and the possibility of working together on this project.

Always Appreciated,
Brittany Lawber
Brittany@censorconstruction.com (email is the best contact method)

name: Compass 70 / Building #4
full_address: S 110th Street & Riverview, Bonner Springs, KS, United States of America
description:
Kadean Construction has been shortlisted as a General Contractor bidder for Compass 70 Building #4, a 248,400 square foot rear-load industrial distribution speculative warehouse. This project consists of site work and utilities, site improvements and pavements, concrete foundations, slabs and concrete tilt-up walls with conventional steel joist and deck framing, TPO roofing and associated architectural finishes. Kadean has completed all mass grading and vertical construction currently completed within this park.

We expect site utility design and architectural elevations to be provided this week, along with pavement markups. Project schedule and further scope clarifications are forthcoming. MEP-FP scopes shall follow RFP requirements - any and all Value Engineering alternates will be reviewed and included in decision for final selection of trade contractors.

Please reach out to Josh Moore (jmoore@kadean.com / 816-686-4552) with any questions.

We look forward to discussing this project further and receiving proposals for this work!

name: Leawood City Hall and Fire Station Restroom Remodel
full_address: 4800 Town Center Drive, Leawood, KS 66211, United States of America
description:
Remodel of 2 separate restroom spaces at 2 different locations:

Leawood Fire Station
14801 Mission Rd, Leawood, KS 66224

Leawood City Hall
4800 Town Center Dr, Leawood, KS, 66211

The pre-bid conference 12/3/25 @1PM will be at the Leawood City Hall location.

!!! UPDATE 1/9/26 ADDENDUM #2 !!!
- The bid date has been pushed to 2/17/26 @12PM

This project is sales tax exempt. There are no wage requirements.

Schedule of Alternates:
  1. (Deduct) - Provide and install painted MMR gypsum board in lieu of wall tile in locations at city Hall indicated in the drawings.
  2. Provide and install thickened wall, cabinets and countertop, painting and other modifications in the Conference Room at City Hall as noted in the drawings.
  3. Provide and install textured stainless steel toilet partition sin lieu of the base bid woodgrain HPL toilet partitions.

Scopes of work include but are not limited to: final clean, demo, finished carpentry, rough carpentry, casework, millwork, roof patching, doors/frames/hardware, glass & lazing, painting, drywall & framing, tile, acoustical ceilings, toilet partitions & bathroom accessories, solid surfaces, fire suppression, plumbing, HVAC, Electrical & Fire alarm.

For the City Hall scope of work, the restrooms on the main level and 2nd level will be phased to have one happen after the other.

Please send bids to myself (miles.perry@centric.build) and bids@centric.build

name: T-Mobile Remodel - #9837 Independence, MO
full_address: 17820 East 39th Street South, Ste. 102, Independence, MO 64055, United States of America
description:
Davaco is bidding on this T-Mobile remodel. We have done several T-Mobile projects over the past couple of years. Please let me know if you need more time to bid.

Non-union. Day work. 7-week project.

Please include trade permit fees in bid if applicable. Trade specific notes are listed in the overview tab in each bid package.

Please review the supporting documents. Design Change Directives (DCDs) overwrite the construction plans. Please bid following both the plans and the DCDs.

Expected Start Date: 7/20/2026
Expected Finish Date: 9/11/2026

Location
T-Mobile #9837
17820 East 39th Street South Ste#102
Independence, MO. 64055

Davaco’s sample COI is attached, and we will need a copy of yours if you submit a bid on this project. Or a qualification in your proposal that states your company meets the insurance requirements.

Documents
Documents are provided in the project files.

Contacts
If you have any questions regarding this project, please don’t hesitate to reach the below contacts.
  • Miguel Cruz
  • Estimator
  • Email – miguel.cruz@davaco.com
  • Phone – (469)223-9331

Bid Conditions:
Subcontractor agrees and understands that any additional terms and conditions listed on quotes will not be binding on DAVACO. Unless the parties mutually agree in writing, Subcontractor’s quotes shall be governed by DAVACO’s Purchase Order terms and conditions. In the event of any discrepancies between the quote and the PO terms, DAVACO’s terms shall govern.
Confidentiality:
By receiving this RFP, you agree to hold all information communicated between your company and DAVACO in strict confidence, during the sourcing process. Further, you agree to not disclose, distribute, or disseminate the information or documents to any third party. You acknowledge and agree that such unauthorized disclosure in any form shall constitute grounds for immediate withdrawal of the RFP and/or rejection of your proposed solution without liability to DAVACO.
Summary:
The information provided in the RFP is subject to change and is not binding on DAVACO. This request for proposal does not commit DAVACO to contract for any supply or service. The release of this RFP should not be construed as a commitment or as authorization to incur cost for which reimbursement would be required or sought. All submissions become DAVACO property and will not be returned.

**** If there are still some items that are getting clarified I am available for more questions and clarifications if needed, DO NOT REACH OUT TO CLIENTS****

name: Southwick House New Transitional Housing Facility
full_address: 115 East Logan Avenue, Emporia, KS 66801, United States of America
description:
New construction of a single-story 9,600 SF residential congregate living facility for women and families. Type V-B combustible wood-framed construction, with automatic NFPA 13 sprinkler system throughout
and fire alarm system throughout. Residential (R-2) occupancy containing 14 private bedrooms and (1) non-congregate independent family unit. Spaces include living and kitchen areas, restrooms, laundry,
offices, and hardened rooms. Scope includes peripheral site and utility improvements. Project is partially funded by CDBG Grant funding, and Contract for the Work is subject to State of
Kansas CDBG Grant Program Regulations and Requirements (Appendices B through D). Sales Tax: Exempt; an exemption certificate will be issued by Lyon County, KS to the successful bidder
after award of the project. CDBG Contract Requirements and Section 3 Housing Requirements: Attention of bidders is particularly
called to the CDBG Contract requirements, as well as requirements related to conditions of employment
to be observed and Section 3 of the 1968 Housing Act, Segregated Facility, Section 109 of the 1984
Housing and Community Development Act and Executive Order 11246 and the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
(See ‘Appendix B’) Build America Buy America (BABA): This agreement is for services related to a project that is subject to
the Build America, Buy America (BABA) Act, 41 USC 8301 note, and all applicable rules and notices, as
may be amended. Absent an approved waiver, all iron, steel, manufactured products, and construction
materials used in this project must be produced in the United States, as further outlined by the Office of
Management and Budget’s Memorandum M-24-02, “Implementation Guidance on Application of Buy
America Preference in Federal Financial Assistance Programs for Infrastructure.” Contractor shall
include Manufacturer’s Certification for BABA requirements for all BABA-covered items to be
incorporated into the infrastructure project. Contractor shall comply with BABA requirements, including
coordination with manufacturers, distributors, and suppliers to correct deficiencies in any BABA
documentation. (See ‘Appendix C’) Wage Determination Rates: Davis Bacon Wages apply to this project; Wage Determination Rates may be
found in ‘Appendix D’ of the specifications.

name: 43rd Street & Clare Road
full_address: West 43rd Street & Clare Road, Shawnee, KS 66226, United States of America
description:
Good morning!
PREMIER is pleased to invite you to bid on this new 354,000 SF Spec Warehouse in Shawnee, KS.

We have great relationship with this client and it seems like the project is moving forward.

I have attached the plans and specs in the link below:
https://pdbgroup.egnyte.com/fl/BVBt33MPXKKP

Have a great day,

name: Scranton Community Center
full_address: 300 Boone Street, Scranton, KS 66537, United States of America
description:
The project consists of the demolition of an existing structure and construction of a new single-story community center located in Scranton, Kansas. The new facility will include assembly space, kitchen facilities, and ADA-compliant restrooms, along with associated site improvements as indicated in the Contract Documents.
This project is federally funded in part through the Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) program and is therefore subject to all applicable federal, state, and local requirements, including but not limited to:
  • Davis-Bacon and Related Acts: All labor performed on site shall be paid in accordance with the applicable Davis-Bacon wage determination, and weekly certified payroll reporting is required.

  • Section 3 of the Housing and Urban Development Act of 1968: Contractors and subcontractors shall comply with Section 3 hiring, contracting, and reporting requirements, including labor-hour tracking and good-faith efforts to meet Section 3 benchmarks.

  • Build America, Buy America Act (BABA): Covered construction materials and manufactured products shall comply with Buy America requirements, including required certifications and documentation.

  • Include All applicable Taxes

All bidders are responsible for reviewing the Contract Documents. Specifications, drawings, and addenda to ensure full compliance with these requirements. Note that specifications related to CDBG Project requirements are included in Addendum 1. Failure to comply with federal labor and procurement requirements may result in bid rejection or contract noncompliance.

Subcontractors are not required to be Section 3 Business Concerns at the time of bid; however, all selected subcontractors must comply with Section 3 hiring, labor-hour tracking, and reporting requirements and cooperate with good-faith efforts to meet Section 3 benchmarks.

There is a Senne Company Bid Form included in the project files that includes a description and signature block for Federal Compliance Acknowledgement (subcontractors). This must be signed and included with your bid submission.


PLEASE NOT THAT SENNE IS ALSO BIDDING ON THE SOUTHWICK HOUSE TRANSITIONAL HOUSING FACILITY DUE ON THE 24th. PLEASE SEND SOUTHWICK BIDS TO GREG Murray at greg@sennecompany.com.
